questions.question: ................................... were the best days of my life.
questions.description: That and those refer to situations that are over.

questions.question: ………………………. says that he wants to watch a movie.
questions.description: This cannot be used without a noun when it refers to people.

questions.question: Put …………………….. down – they are dirty.
questions.description: When this, that, these and those refer to things, they can be used with or without articles.

questions.question: ………………………… is very tasty. Can I have some more?
questions.description: We use this to talk about people and things which are close to us.

questions.question: Get ……………………….. cat off the piano.
questions.description: We use that and those to talk about people and things which are away from us.

questions.question: I don’t know what I am doing in ……………………. company.
questions.description: Here the present continuous verb clearly indicates that we are talking about something that is going on at the moment. We use this and these in these contexts.

questions.question: All the time I worked at …………………….. company I hated it.
questions.description: That and those refer to situations that are over.

questions.question: You shouldn’t have behaved like ……………………….
questions.description: That and those refer to situations that are over.

questions.question: A dog’s intelligence is much greater than ………………………..
questions.description: That and those are often used with a following description to mean ‘the ones’.

questions.question: …………………….. who have not yet registered should do so immediately.
questions.description: Those who means the people who. These cannot be used with this meaning.

questions.question: It was so cold ………………………… I could see my breath.
questions.description: We use that in the conjunction so…that.

questions.question: ‘How was the movie?’ ‘Not all ………………………. good.’
questions.description: Not all that can mean not very.
